oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civil War navy buttons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three Civil War navy buttons. Far left: made by Josh Starkey of 23 Conduit St., London. Middle button: Made by Waterbury Scovill Company. Far right: reads "Extra Quality" on the back. Starkey Companies produced Civil War buttons in England. Waterbury Scovill Co. was based in Waterbury, CT as a button and sewing hardware factory. The company developed the U.S.'s first gilt buttons.
